posts.com:
>Spirit Away
Ghost / Status / —% Acc. / -6 priority
At the end of the turn, the user and the target are both switched out.

>Tag-In
Fighting / Physical / 40 BP / 100% Acc.
The user teams up with their ally to strike the target twice. The user switches out after hitting the target, and their ally replacing them performs the second hit. If there are no remaining Pokémon in the party, this move fails.
>(alternate concept since I don't think the game can actually handle switching Pokémon mid-move)
Fighting / Physical / 60 BP / 95% Acc.
The user teams up with their ally to strike the target twice. The second hit does damage based on the ally's Attack, and has an independent chance to miss or crit. If the user doesn't have an ally on the field, this move fails.

>Make Mischief
Fairy / Physical / 60 BP / 100% Acc.
The user plays a prank on the target. This may make the target flinch (30%).

>Lunacy
Fairy / Physical / 140 BP / 100% Acc.
The user becomes confused, then goes on a rampage for 3 turns, attacking any target on the field indiscriminately (including allies in doubles). Afterward, or if the move fails to be executed for any reason, the user must rest for a turn.

posts.com:
>>52896148
Abilities
>Tantalizing Aroma
On entering battle, lowers opponent's Evasion by two stages.
>Pyrophyte
Reduces damage done by Fire-type moves. Raises Sp.Atk and Sp.Def by one stage upon being hit by a Fire-type move.
>Who would I give these abilities to
Generally, any Grass or Bug type without access to a secondary ability, with certain exceptions. Designs/lore with emphasis on smells/flame resistance would also be considered, but real life inspirations would be favored over competitive viability when determining receipt. Examples:
-Carnivine would have access to both, replacing Levitate. Pyrophyte would become HA.
-Bellsprout and Oddish lines would get Tantalizing Aroma in addition to its current abilities
-Snover line would receive Pyrophyte as a HA, making Soundproof its secondary

Move
>Heavenly Mandate
Dragon, Special
BP 100
Functions identically to Burn Up but for Dragon types, but changes category based on what would do the most damage
>Who would I give this move to
In general, any fully-evolved Dragon type in need of a little extra boost to its viability. In Smogon terms, nothing currently in OU would get it, but anything RU and below would.

posts.com:
>Rock Burst
Rock / Physical / 90 BP / 90% Acc. / 15pp
Detonates all Stealth Rocks on the field removing them and dealing damage to all Pokemon on the field. If both sides of the field have Stealth Rocks, then the BP of Rock Burst is doubled. If there are no Stealth Rocks on the field, then this move fails. Deals no damage to Rock-type Pokemon.

>Spike Burst
Normal / Physical / BP Varies / 90% Acc. / 15pp
Detonates all Spikes and Toxic Spikes on the field removing them and dealing damage to all Pokemon on the field. BP is increased by 30 for each set of spikes, both regular and toxic. If Toxic Spikes are burst, then all Pokemon hit by Spike Burst will be poisoned. If there are no Spikes or Toxic Spikes on the field, then this move fails. Poison type Pokemon don't take additional damage for each Toxic Spike.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52896148
I have a million ideas for things like this and tend to post in these threads. I'll try to do just the ones that are most interesting to me right now for the current meta

>Oxidizer
Poison / Special / 60bp
The user secretes a powerful reagent that begins to oxidize the target's cells. This move is always super effective on Steel types

>Blast Chiller
Ice / Special / 70bp
The user blows a rapid, freezing cold wind that quickly drops the target's temperature. This move is always super effective on Fire types.

>Briar Patch
Grass / Status
Causes strangling, prickly vines to overgrow on the opponent's side of the field. When the opponent switches out, the incoming Pokémon becomes snared and cannot switch back out. (This works as an entry hazard that basically locks in and traps whichever Pokémon come in while it's active. Like other entry hazards, it does not affect airborne Pokémon and can be removed by Spin and Defog. Because it is a trapping move, it is also ignored by Pokémon immune to traps like Ghost types. Finally, it can be cleared up and removed just by switching in a Grass or Fire type -- similar to poison types and toxic spikes)

>Undertow
Water / Status
Places a flowing stream with a reverse current under the opposing team's feet. All grounded Pokemon on the opposing side will move at a slower speed.

>Logjam
Grass / Physical / 90bp / Hits all Pokemon
The user hurls a massive stack of logs into the air, smashing them into all Pokemon on the field. The leftover timber blocks the way out for all Pokémon on the field and clears up in three turns.

It's a bit of both, honestly. I know that I have some not so fond memories of old submas fandom, there was a lot of edgy chuuni stuff and the way they were characterized by fans was hilariously bad, what with Pokemon Masters and PLA not existing yet to help develop their personalities. It was really just a lot of creative liberties and making shit up, for better or for worse. Also fujoshi dominated the fandom almost entirely, which was a bit of a shame if you're not into yaoi (and in my case even the alternatives of Elesa and Hilda being shipped with them didn't really do it for me most of the time, either...) But the way the fandom is now that it's been revived, I would argue that it's a little bit worse just because fandoms these days tend to be worse in general due to chronically online teens with mental illnesses. Ah well, I guess peculiar characters will attract peculiar people. I'm not exactly innocent either, being a delusional yume with my own quirks and all, the only difference in getting older when you're a weirdo is that you hide it better.

The first fanfic I ever read when I was 12 was an Altoshipping fic called "Guardian of the Chosen One" by XD-385. It gets a bit insane with a dark shonen plot where Ash basically discovers he has Goku-esque superpowers (because he's the "Chosen One" mentioned in the Orange Islands), but it's a guilty pleasure that I still enjoy. He and Latias reconnect, have sex, have two shiny Lati babies, and eventually get married. And I LOVED all of it. I should really re-read it again sometime.

>>52882540
>>52882547
>>52882549
>bullshit schema the userbase comes up with
Character Tags are completely standard, as well as Pairings which are regularized to [Character A]/[Character B] for romance and [Character A]&[Character B] for friendship. From there, freeform tags (user submitted) are corrected/Linked by Tag wranglers to a standard form if they exist. If you tag something "[Character]'s Daddy Issues", your local tag wrangler will have that become a subtag to "Daddy Issues" and "Parental Issues", so if you search those tags, you'll still find the original fic. Mistagged fics are flagged by wranglers/standard users and the authors will be asked to fix them in egregious cases. If these things haven't happened, it's either because of the fic hasn't been gotten to, or the fandom isn't popular enough to have wranglers (who are just local fandom volunteers). Fandoms from there with very popular tropes or AUs will then gain fandom-specific tags. For the Pokemon anime " Ash Ketchum Has Aura Powers" is a popular tag, with a subtag "Aura Guardian Ash Ketchum" (since not every fic with Ash having Aura powers is him as an Aura Guardian). It also has a whole legion of synonyms that wranglers have tagged, such as
>Aura User Ash
>aura user!ash
>Aura!Ash
>AuraAsh
All of these were user-submitted tags that were made synonyms of the overarching tag for you to search. Any other tags from there are going to ones too specific to the story that the author still felt it important for you to know, which while yes can be excessive at times, does not make searching any harder.
Ao3 may be dense and the user tags at times way too long and unnecessary, however, finding what you like is not its problem in the slightest. Any issue that exists in Ao3's searchability is present in other sites as well. You just need to learn how to use its interface.
Source: Long time user of Ao3, Fimfiction, and FFN and former tag wrangler for the former.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>52882370
There are no rules on Fimfiction. There are no rules moderators follow when deciding to enforce their will upon the site. Meta fics (about fimfiction and its users) are supposedly not allowed, except they are, unless staff don't like them. Making a group for the explicitly stated purpose of harassing authors and mocking stories with bad reddit scores is allowed, unless the staff don't like your group politically. Staff are fine with harassment, but they do what they can to censor users to create the illusion that their views are the norm. You will never hear worse writing advice on this site chanted like it's gospel. When it comes to group moderation, it's a two-headed coin flip whether the staff will side with the user being attacked and ganged up on for making something the group didn't like, or claim the victim's out of line for responding (insert adverb here) and side with the entitled abusers. Fimfiction is where intellectual writing critique goes to light itself aflame and commit seppuku. The genuine retards there think Past Sins and Fallout Equestria are what all good fanfictions should strive to be.

I'm convinced this is the reason why so many writers on that site are ignored (until a hate group targets them), and many are lavished with undue praise for getting about 100 followers and creating a hugbox of 10 circlejerkers for writing mediocre masturbatory crap. It's hard to get your work read at all without the cooperation of the Featured Box. This does not use an algorithm, and is used to advertise whatever stories site staff like; if you criticize this they'll use the excuse that algorithms are easily gamed once their rules are figured out.

There are groups on the site for stories of a specific length, which will take in only stories under 5k words, or over 50k words, or over 100k words, or over 1 million words. Writers are encouraged to needlessly bloat what they write in order to hopefully get these groups to notice their stories at all.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>Vs Atticus
>Skuntank
I send in Sceccu, who Terastalizes immediately.
The Skuntank manages to deal some nasty damage with a Sucker Punch Crit right of the bat, but Stamina will weaken most followiing blows. High Horsepower deletes the Skunk.
>Revavroom
It Iron Heads Sceccu, but does less than impressive damage, and Stamina keeps racking up.
High Horsepower takes the motor mon out.
>Muk
It uses Sludge Wave, but it does fairly little- just enough to push Sceccu into Mago Berry range. Stamina keeps stacking.
High Horsepower misses, and Muk scores a Sludge Wave crit before falling to a second attempt. More Stamina is building up.
>Navi Starmobile
Spin Out does basically nothing except put Sceccu's defense up to +5, and High Horsepower does about half of the Starmobile's health.
Another Spin Out caps out Sceccu's defense just in time for him to end the fight with another High Horsepower.
I honestly think Stamina Mudsdale is seriously banworthy in Nuzlockes, and if it hadn't been the shiny I caught this run, I would not have run it on my team.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52836911
In a world were no other mons but the starters exist, Tepig might be the best, as it has arguably the best typing and matchups of the three.
But in the actual games, it has so many top tier mons that compete for its role. Archeops Flying type somewhat overlaps fire, Darumaka is broken, and the game drowns you in excellent Fighting types.
Meanwhile, Oshawott has almost no competition for the role as best Water-type. The Tympole line is the most notable contender and it is worse overall.
Outside Nuzlockes, Simipour is arguably the best Water-type because it is powerful and can be fully evolved and spamming Scald at level 22, but the frailty makes me think twice. Samurott doesn't really have to contend with it since the best version of the monkey is the gift version(arrives earlier so you don't have to grind later) which you won't get unless you picked Snivy.

Magikarp is a pain in the ass to train from Lv. 5 to Lv. 20. It’s better to use the Daycare Center but the truth is that by the time you get him back from being Lv. 19, he’ll have fallen off and need to catch up to the rest of the team.

I’ve used Sandslash in a casual playthrough before. He was amazing because he has early access to Dig, easy access to Slash, eventual access to Rockslide and Earthquake, and also bonus access to Swords Dance. sadly, he’s too slow to make proper use of Sword Dance but he still evolves very early, has good physical bulk, and hits all the abundant poison types in the game with STAB ground moves.

>>52854251
Cubchoo and Litwick are great gets.

>>52855126


>>52851910
Sandile is one of those ones that you just pump full of Defence EVs.
I've noticed that pumping up a big weakness with EVs in an in-game runs tends to end better than maxing out already good stats. Even something Like Sharpedo needs max Attack but only some Speed investment and the rest can go into a Defence or Sp.Defence.

In general if you look at a pokemon stats, investment taking a Defence from really low to decent gives a bigger benefit than taking a decent defence to great.
100 ATK vs. 50, 75, 100, 125, 150 Defence gives damage multipliers of 2.0, 1.33, 1.0, 0.8, 0.67. You can see how there's diminishing returns and the biggest difference in damage dealt is from 50 to 75 Defence. That difference in an in-game setting is far more useful than 100 to 125. That being said a defensive pivot is great to have since 75 and 200 Defence still have a gap of 0.83.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52858691
Yeah. You can always just do some calculations and see how much you can EV before reaching a level cap or level you want to end at.
Just think of the earliest area you can find those EVs, in RSEORAS you can get Attack EVs from Level 2-3 Poochyena at route 1.
>TotalEVs=EXPlimit/AverageEXPperKill
Then you add them in PkHex, or use Vitamins to the nearest 10 up to 100, you hack into the PC storage or bag.
I personally have no qualms about that, it's functionally the same as grinding since there's no danger of getting killed anyway.
I don't add money, TMs, tokens etc. since those are a finite resources, or uncertain in the case of non-savescummed tokens, but stuff like multiplying berries once I've found them or the EV training trick are fair game since it's just cutting out tedium that I could do on hardware.

tl;dr: Anything that is available, safe, and possible to do in-game is fine to hack in.

Black 2 randomized run (including items and abilities), set mode

I'm about to grind for the elite 4 and champion battle

>Salamance (starter)
Good stats, lacks a physical dragon type move (doesn't get dragon claw until lvl 61, no tm for it either) which kinda sucks but stab dragonbreath + fly is pretty strong and drain punch + ice fang gives it pretty good coverage

>Choiceband Darmanitan
stab flareblitz and superpower one shots basically any 2x or 4x weakness and even most 1x weakness mons too.

>Leftovers Forretress
Tanky piece of shit, great for pivots, has shadow sneak and stab gyroball, but isn't really suited for dealing any meaningful amount of damage. Also has volt absorb which is nice ig if one of the e4 randomizes to have an electric team.

>Cofagrigus
Another tanky fuck for switching into normal/fighting moves, also generally high def. Has willowwisp for slowing down physical attackers and decent stab shadow ball, with an alright sp.atk.

>Sniper Togekiss
Serene grace would have been nutty, but alas, I'll take the improved crits though. Good sp.def. too for switching into, and great sp.atk. Doesn't really contribute with any coverage however.

>Empoleon
Aqua Jet for priority, and stab surf is pretty alright, good defensive option for pivoting back into Darmanitan or Salamence I suppose, not completely sold on it

Any input on the final team? It's been a rough run so far

It falls to a single Flower Trick as well.
>Dachsbun
Flower Trick does big damage, but doesn't knock it out. It hits back pretty hard with Play Rough.
The dog manages to sneak in Baby-Doll Eyes before falling to another Flower trick.
>Ruchbah Starmobile
I swap in Bonny Lass(wearing an Assault Vest) as the car uses Misty Terrain.
Steel Roller does pretty much nothing, which Bitter Blade heals it back up.
Confuse Ray causes Bonny Lass to hit herself.
And this is pretty much how it goes from this point on:
Bonny shrugs off damage, occasionally hits herself, then heals back up with Bitter Blade until the Starmobile finally falls.

Don't forget to give Kaso Thuder Punch when he evolves into Typhlosion.
Also, I know you asked yesterday, but I think Espeon is way better than Umbreon in gen2. A lot of the things that made Umbreon good aren't available here yet; sure, it still has nice defenses, but you're gonna be stuck with Toxic to deal with most mons.
Meanwhile Espeon gets recovery too, is fast and hits hard, and it gets Bite being special in gen2, which means it pretty much beats every other Psychic type in the game. I'm talking from experince: I had an Espeon in my first nuzlocke ever.

Just be careful if you end up grinding in the Victory Road, gravelers carry self-destruct with them and it's nasty shit.
Pic related was my buddy barely surviving an encounter like that on 15hp.

This thread is for the growth of artists and those who draw for fun. If you're going to give critique, please do it constructively. Rude or blunt critiques won't help anybody.

Requesters are free to request what they wish, but avoid bumping your request every half hour as it's only going to put people off; try giving it a few hours or more.

Please provide references in ONE image, especially when requesting something outside of the Pokémon universe. If you request something from the old Drawthread or a separate thread, COPY & PASTE the actual request instead of posting a link.

Also, be mindful that requests are done at the discretion of the artists, not on a first come first serve basis.

Please remember to save any piece of art you like from these threads, as we may never know when the archive will start deleting images again. Artists can and are recommended to post their works on other outlets for archival purposes.

Recognize I’m the minority on these though

>would be good for a few sets
No, it would be good for a whole era, maybe even two. Nowadays sets contain more than 200 cards, of which more than a dozen gold rares, rainbow rares, alternate arts, etc. Which are incredibly hard to pull. To complete one set (not a master set, so no reverse holos) you have to open a fuckton of booster boxes, even several cases. And yes, it'd be easier to buy the singles you need, but then you'd have to spend an enormous amount of money on cards you didn't even want in the first place, only to complete one fucking set!
That's just outrageous, it's really getting out of hand, if you ask me. It would be fun to return to the older times IMHO, where regular holos had a great holo pattern and actually looked good. Where sets didn't have more than 200 cards. Where there were no rainbow rares which have barely visible """artwork"""".
>inb4 muh genwun
I'm not even talking about Base etc., I really liked the EX era with their Delta Species or the DPP sets. Damn, I enjoyed even BW and XY more than some SwSh sets. Best of all still remains NEO thugh.

https://www.pokeclicker.com/
Pokéclicker is an open-source game built around the story and content of the Pokémon games. This is an idle & clicker type game that is currently in beta release phase. New content and patches are released frequently.

>>52903274
If nothing else, what they could do is make use of the real evo mechanic for them. Evolve your Pokemon into Mega, you lose the original Pokemon, but it's Attack is transferred to the Mega (And it comes with a damage multiplier).
This fixes a lot of the issues with Megas. They'd now have a benefit beyond just being another checkmark, but they would also keep the idea of you wanting to breed the Pokemon before Mega Evolving it, it's just no longer mandatory.
The buff could either be in line with legendary held items (50%), or if we want to take Held Items into account to keep them in line with that, make it 25%. (25% + a 20% Held Item multiplicatively gets you exactly 50% extra)

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com: Wiglett/Wugtrio along with Toedscool/Toedscruel are examples of 'convergent evolution'. Creatures that don't look completely alike but share the same ancestor are divergent evolution (think Scyther/Scizor/Kleavor, and regional forms like Paldean Wooper/Tauros). Convergent is when two animals look physically similar but come from completely different ancestors (irl examples include Hummingbirds / Hummingbird Hawk-Moths). Although a more accurate depiction of convergent evolution would be something like a octopus ending up looking like Tentacruel, since they both would face similar underwater challenges.

Open team sheets put you on a (mostly) level playing field with the top player cliques that will give their friends info on your team between sets. So yes, surprise gimmicks won't work, but simultaneously having a large friend group won't provide and advantage. It's a more level playing field.

>>52904789
When you enter a raid, there's a plus sign button on the right side above your roster. Pressing that button opens your friends list to invite from.

When you get invited to a remote raid, your radar thingy in the bottom right will turn orange, and the raid tab will show you which raid you're invited to. From there it's just a normal remote raid.

Work quickly in both cases, because remote raiders still have to get in during the two-minute lobby timer.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52906255
Special Pokemon such as shines, costumes, and legendaries are exempt from roster cuts, unless you absolutely don't care for them
If you don't PvP, keep your highest-CP mon of each family and any perfect IVs, dump the rest
If you do PvP, use Poke Genie to evaluate each Pokemon's IVs, sort them according to the league you want to enter them in, then by IV rating, then level, basically keep whichever ones won't be a pain in the ass to raise
If you're not a collector, dump the shitmons as well
If you can, trade away anything that isn't an absolute shitmon instead of transferring it, you currently get an extra candy and a candy XL for trading

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com: Satoshi's initial idea for Pokemon was to have every game create an auto generated regional map like mystery dungeon but on a bigger. From the very beginning they wanted to make sure that every cartridge was it's own world that's why trainer ID was implemented. However the randomize generator was scrapped because you couldn't implement a coherent story with it.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com: Sounds interesting, but hard to make. Even Dragon Warrior Monsters had the dungeons out of pre-assembled parts and encounters were fixed in each location.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52904318
>>52904419
It might be possible in theory. It would need to be pieced together out of various routes, which themselves could be pieced out of certain tiles.
For story based events, you'd basically need to lock in certain buildings to being in certain towns, like having a Team Rocket hideout in Town 4 with a roadblock that prevents you from leaving until you clear it out, even if the rest of the town is more randomized, such as the type of the gym leader, and any people who hand out TMs or have in-game trades.

It would also run the risk of needing to be too linear, since a randomly generated region wouldn't have as many clean ways of gating a player off, or requiring them to backtrack. Something like Cerulean having a cut tree to progress and requiring you to go north for a ticket, and then south to another town through a mini-dungeon to actually get cut might not be the easiest to pull off.
Still, it could be interesting, as it's essentially akin to a randomizer, but more coherent, since the pokemon available could more closely match the environments of the randomly generated routes.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52904318
Tajiri only mentions "the shapes of a forest" and which pokemon would appear.
I think this feature has been over exaggerated over time; and i'm pretty sure it was cut for being too hard to implement rather than anything else.

And i think it would have worked incredibly well if it was handled by competent programmers; Masuda saved the project in a different way(trying to get gamefreak away from a pretty large scope idea) rather than the idea inherently being flawed.
Pokemon is perfectly designed for this in its current state; there's a lot of redundant mons(and they had more hanging around in their back pockets) and the dungeon mechanics are simple enough that random chunks slapped together would work absolutely fine.
The final pokemon was very flimsy in terms of how personalized it was; basically every kid had the same few mons and its not like you were going to trade your only unique mons(the starters) so this would have really helped with the whole trading ideal.

Tbh I don't think I do anything special, ever since I was a toddler it's grown really fast (even when I was born I already had my head fully covered lol). My mom also has really long hair so I'm guessing it's genetic. It's currently at 103cm more or less, last year it had a sudden growth spurt out of nowhere (was at like 96 before), don't know why. If it helps, I use Elvive shampoo and conditioner, though sometimes (like twice a month because it's expensive and I need it to last) for the latter I use Tio Nacho instead. I also don't brush very often actually so I'm not constantly pulling at it, and when I do it's very gentle (start from the bottom/tips, with your other hand grab just a bit above it so you don't pull, once that's done grab a bit higher and brush again, continue until you're brushing all of it).
It does become a bit bothersome at times, like getting it stuck in handles without me noticing and having my head pulled back, accidentally sitting on it, bending over and the tips touching the floor (awful if it's wet... ), but other than that it's really nice and I want to see how long it can get tbqh. I can wrap it like a scarf during winter, or feel like some forest fairy when I'm naked at home and it falls all over my body, idk it's just really nice and soft, I can also do a lot of hair dos which is fun.

>>52856078
Since pokemon invoked the existence of a multiverse a couple generations back, you can say that G/S/C takes place in a different universe/timeline from HG/SS. Or you could just decide that G/S/C is 100% noncanon and is fully replaced by the similar-but-slightly-different HG/SS content. Either way the idea of steel types being " recently discovered" doesn't work if you allow for the type chart to be something that exists within canon rather than a game extraction, because then the nature of reality somehow changes as pokemon researchers discover things. The setting turns into madness where subjective reality trumps scientific rigor and it gets worse then harder you try to make it make sense. Best to just ignore the retcon.

>>52896637
Rotation is hard to grasp initially.
>It basically is single but with aspects of doubles play.
>You can switch the normal way or you can rotate.
>Switching activates abilties that pop when you switch it in but rotation doesn't.
>Rotation does not reset conditions like confusion and bad poison, or reset Ability counters like Slow Start.
>Rotation adds more aspects of speed control into the game since rotation doesn't remove debuffs when rotating as well as letting you use say Tail Wind then rotate to another mon to do shit asap.
>Moves that only work on turn one such as Fake Out will be conserved until the user rotates in.
>Perish Song only counts down on the turn an afflicted Pokémon has been rotated in or stays in play.
>abilities and moves that announce their presence such as Mold Breaker and Air Balloon will not be shown if the Pokémon with them are sent out in the back.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52896637
Too many possible actions in a turn such that it becomes a complete guessing game
Single battle: 4 moves + up to 5 switch-ins: Up to 9 actions (before accounting for tera/dynamax/z-move)
Double battle: 4 possible moves on one of 3 targets twice, plus 8 switches (4 possible switches for each mon): Up to 32 actions
Not gonna do the math for triple/rotation but you can see what I'm getting at

Hop, SwSh's primary rival, is Leon's little brother just so he can keep going on about Leon and how he wants to be like him, which is why Hop is a trainer at all. Sonia's backstory is how she was a childhood rival of Leon who couldn't compare and so dropped out of the Gym Challenge. Leon gives you and Hop the starters over the Professor and gives you both the endorsement to actually participate in the Gym Challenge at all. Leon teaches you how to catch Pokemon. The goal of you and all your rivals throughout SwSh is to become Champion, aka, beat Leon, and it's far more explicit and important in SwSh than in any other game. The ultimate goal of the anime right now is "beat Leon", and the main reason Ash is even participating in the World Tournament is because he looks up to and wants to fight Leon. Leon saves you from Slumbering Weald, the labyrinth mythical forest, despite supposedly being bad at directions. Leon saves the day in other instances where you or someone else could have. Leon is Rose's trump card against Eternatus, and this is pretty much the only time Leon struggles and fails against anything before you beat him. Leon is stated to have been Mustard's best student. Leon's ace is Charizard over an actual Galar native Pokemon just to promote him further. The Twilight Wings mini-series' overarching plot is about a boy who loves Leon and wants to see him battle. Galar worships this fucker and the ground he stands on. (cont.)

>we wont do the battle frontier anymore, because kids these days have mobile games!
>we wont do any more Colosseum games, even though they are fan favourites and highly after sought, because, well idk haha!
Can someone tell me what's going through his brain? Why is it seemingly impossible to give their fanbase what they want? How is this guy in charge?

I understand that Pokémon is a massive brand, and that they can lowball everything, because there will always be the next generation of kids that will play it for the brand alone, along with the hardcore whales that will buy anything with a Pokémon label. But is that really an excuse to downgrade and cut corners? Do they think that Pokémon is to big to fail, so that they don't have to put any effort into anything?

I think Lego and The Pokémon Company are very similar. Lego started out as a kids brand, but as time went by, Adult fans started to become the main fambase and consumers, (AFOL/adult fan of lego). It took ages for Lego to realise this, but they eventually started to cater to their adult fanbase, as they became aware that AFOL's and collectors are the main consumers of Lego.

Pokémon KNOWS Kanto is their most profitable region, because it's what ADULTS love. They just can't help themselves but pander to it. It's time for them to take the next step, based on this logic, stop downgrading the newer games and regions, and you you will see profits behind your compression, because EVERYONE likes quality.

I'm not planning to, I just want to fortify my skills as a writer before I return to it.
My prose is bearable, but having just started writing only recently, I've noticed severe shortcomings relating to pacing, characterisation, and the stringing of actual plotlines together. I can improve, I know that for certain.
I've become quite fond of the setting and characters, and would like to do them, and the books and movies upon which they are based, justice.
You got any story requests? I might look into them once I finish pt. 2 of the Lucario story.

Watch some. You won't regret it.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
So I have been thinking about more how much of a missed opportunity it was that they didn't release Ash-Greninja alongside Serena's Greninja.

Ash-Greninja is very popular and well known and is one of the most badass things Pokemon has produced, and its been disrespected a lot lately.

Here's a concept I had in mind for how Ash-Greninja could've been.

Neo-Champion Serena would have had the Shiny Greninja and it would've been a support like how Calem's currently is.

Instead of Calem, we get Ash and Ash-Greninja. Ash-Greninja would be a Special Striker.

Some moves I concepted are as follows:

>Water Shuriken
Works exactly like how the current Serena's Greninja's Water shuriken does, but does a little more damage.

>Cut
A powerful physical normal attack that hits a single target and never misses.

>Double Team
Works like how the current Shiny Greninja's Double Team works, but gives more speed and evasion and heals Ash-Greninja more.

>"Let-z Go!" or, "Iku-Z!"
A self-buff that grants Ash and Greninja insane speed and damage and will be the move that transforms Greninja into Ash-Greninja. This will make their damage strong enough to nearly one-shot any enemy, but can only be used once and only affects Ash. This is partially based off how Ash-Greninja was so powerful that it almost destroyed Diantha's Mega Gardevoir, if he didn't pass out.

>Sync Move: Bond Phenomenon Water Shuriken
Ash-Greninja's Sync Move is none other than the big golden Water Shuriken he summoned against Alain in the Kalos League Finals. Imagine if something like that actually hit? This is a guaranteed one-shot if it connects, but comes at the cost of 50% of Ash and Greninja's current health. This can only be used if Ash has transformed Greninja into Ash-Greninja using "Iku-Z!"/"Let-z Go!"

I haven't designed the grid yet, but I was thinking that some of the grid could be used to power up his Water Shuriken and Cut, and maybe something that guarantees a set amount of dodges from Double Team.

Cont.

The story for this event will mix the games and the anime, and focus on Ash and Serena's childhood and bond.

It will show Serena getting upset at losing to something and Ash cheering her up, and the two of them using the power of their respective Greninjas to overcome this threat. This impresses Diantha who gives them a chance to double battle her and a surprise cameo in Alain. Ash and Serena beat them, and are named the Neo Champions.

The ending has Ash and Serena celebrating, and Serena promising that she will stick by Ash no matter what, since she now feels like she's worthy enough to stand by his side as an equal.

I didn't want to overload the story with Amourshipping but still keep enough of it there to make fans happy.

It’s funny how, because of PoMas’s battle mechanics, if they choose to replicate Slow Start it might actually not matter all that much, because most of the time you’re throwing around buffs for the first 3 turns anyways.

If they’re going to include it at all, I think the ideal scenario is that it deactivates on the first ally sync. Having to wait a full 5 turns would suck, but with its unlocked stats it can easily dish out a strong round 2 sync nuke regardless.

That’s one thing I like about these silly spin-off games, they can give some spotlight to shitmons and make them actually decent outside the constraints of the main series game mechanics.

>>52883928
There’s no “too late” for this game until they announce EOS is on the horizon, which probably won’t be for at least another year or two.

The game is easy enough that you can clear the hardest content after 2-3 months of playing, and there’s no PVP so it doesn’t matter if you don’t have all the best units. Once you’ve hit that level the game doesn’t demand much of your time, it’s about 10 minutes to do all the dailies and maybe half an hour to clear champion stadium/battle villa/legendary gauntlet whenever they drop.

Game’s mostly for pulling for your waifus/husbandos and seeing cute story snippets every once in a while. If that sounds like it could appeal to you there’s no harm in giving it a shot.

Part of what makes Clavell at least somewhat threatening is that a lot of his team options either have some setup or just wide coverage options. Yawn, Reflect, Aurora Veil, and Will-o-Wisp can all give him more openings, alongside Spore/Toxic Amoongus or his other mons which will just load up on coverage.

The eeveelutions can't pull off that amount of coverage to nearly the same degree, but it also feels like they don't even try. Flareon lacks Trailblaze even though that would help with all of its weaknesses and shore up speed, as though Fire Spin would do anything. Espeon would have been a better inclusion since it actually gets quite a bit of coverage along with high speed and special attack, but in order for that to work, the rest of the team would need to be set up better to spread around status or set up screens, rather than all of them just having Babydoll Eyes and Quick Attack.

>>52882568
>Lucario
Yeah pretty much. It hogs some good moves to itself, steals signatures from others (i.e., Bonemerang), and prevents us from finally getting a dedicated Special oriented fighting type. I don't really hate other fighting types, I more or less feel indifferent about some designs that don't appeal to me. I just want to see
>actual martial arts inspired brawlers again
>creativity with moves/abilities/themes
or ideally both. CC and Superpower and all other "burst of power" moves are so generic and devoid of what made the type unique in the early generations. I want some new punching moves, grappling effects, kicks, chops, etc. Where are our clerical/pivot support that can pull all sorts of hijinks like force an opponent out with a red card, or enforce rules like Inverse battles or auto-trick rooms?

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52879198
>If Square Enix made Pokemon.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52883091
Eat food when you need a specific effect like encounter power to find a rare spawn easier, raid power to get bonus rewards from raids, etc.
Custom sandwiches are the best since you can make basically any type and ability combo you want. The premade recipe book is good for main game and searching for a specific ability if you don't know how the sandwich system works.
Buy ingredients like whenever, I would buy like 10 of everything you don't have yet when you see it.

Eventually if you want to go for shinies, these recipes attached are convenient. There's a dozen different resources scattered around online for other more specific recipes, so just Google search for a specific ability + type if you're curious or try to theory craft a sandwich at this link
https://cecilbowen.github.io/pokemon-sandwich-simulator/

>First four all have unique niches/gimmicks supporting them

>>52870392
>I stonefaced through the entirety of Saving Private Ryan
I'm glad to learn that I'm not the only one who wasn't really touched by it. The opening action and a few scenes were well crafted, but it's hard to say, "Thank God the Matt Damon bloodline will have a chance to perpetuate!" (Were it made today, the twist ending would be that he's the gay brother. In your face, patrilineal boomer culture!)

>The Green Mile
I think it somewhat depends on whether your mindset is of empathy or sympathy. With the Noble Sacrifice trope in play, my mindset is to respect the choice but not feel bad about it, rather to honor it. Others would feel bad with the sacrificial action and feel bad that the greater good is done at a great cost.

>Requiem for a Dream
Again, I can respect the choice but I don't feel bad about it. Do drugs, fine; pay the price, fine. To me it's a cautionary tale, not a work of pathos.

>Titanic
Insurance fraud is a heck of a deal. Conspiracy theory aside, it's a nice portrait of people reacting to the near-inevitable. But only the supporting cast interesting. The lead characters are dorks and their scenes mostly feel like a bad soap opera with good production values. Fortunately I got to play with the "chilling at the front of a boat" meme in my long-neglected next story.

>the finale of Cowboy Bebop
I like how despite the cliche anime "action" there's a load of tiny callbacks that respect viewers for paying attention to the motifs carried by the plot.

>a greater sense of despair and despondency than just about any other work has?
I don't outline, so things can go realistically badly without concern for a Hollywood Ending moment.

posts.name: cge0361
posts.com:
>>52874191
>/vpwt/ is an unresurectable community
I've seen the thread reappear occasionally, but it no longer endures. Talking out of my ass, I'd lay the blame on:

1) the "old guard" leaving, mostly to OC so they would have market potential, which is understandable.
2) too few newbies/too many celebs. There were a couple of writers updating frequently but very few ambitious beginners looking to get meaningful critique on ideas for short pieces. We used to have a lot of that. Without, the thread turns into a RSS feed.
3) Lack of fresh commentary. As the thread became increasingly two people updating and someone save bumping, the thread became boring to read.
4) PMD began dominating. Although the species are the same, there's a huge difference in the context frame between humans+pokemon versus pokemon living in a mock-human society. That isn't to say that PMD is worse or better, but that it's easy for people who want stories about humans interacting with pokemon to feel underserved when PMD becomes all that's updating.
5) Discord extracted what little social conversation was left.

>I never did read anything of yours while it existed, though.
Understandable and expected, it was a while ago.

>I'd add my own Mienshao fics to the pile but all I have is fetish smut
Although I've always been extra critical of lemons, I appreciate when an author "validates" a fetish by making a story that features, but is not defined by, topics that are typically cheap fetish tones. I've touched on at least a half dozen fetish categories, but by touching and exploring instead of just re-walking the lemons' default paths, it can not only tell a story most wouldn't notice could be told, but also fly under the radar.

>the fourth book in a series that's 400k words long
Sounds like you've put in the reps

>What do you think you'd write if you started again?
Hopefully the other half of my next story that's been waiting for me to work it out.

posts.name: cge0361
posts.com:
>>52883730
Know your style. Some use outlines and design plot arcs. Others work spins on classical act structures or heroes' journies. My style is to simply type while I daydream. Each method has drawbacks and advantages; discover what's most effective for you.

As for my style, I have some principles that I follow as much as I can.

• Never force a plot development. Because I transcribe what I imagine, I don't really know what's going to happen next, and I refrain from trying to decide what "should" happen. Some writers enjoy spitballing possibilities and picking something they like best; I bristle at so much as thinking twice about something unless it's because it's struck me as contradictory (rarely happens, usually because I forgot small details along the way, and since my stories are one large continuity there are a lot of small details to forget).

• Never undo a plot development (unless it's boring). Specifically that means that if something happens in the daydream and I wish that it hadn't as I finish typing that sentence, it's set in stone. This is because...

• Never write for oneself. There are enough author's wish fulfillment pieces to stack in a tower that touches the moon. Another is not needed. Furthermore, if I write at a subject matter I know that I like, it's a story I already know. I'd rather write a story that nobody, including myself, has heard before.

• Always find the final sentence before getting there. The last line is burdened with the responsibility of being the sound that the book makes when it is shut. It could be gentle, or it can be a snap, but it is the lasting impression. Every word before it leads to that moment. Make the most of it to reward readers who stuck out the piece.

(cont)

posts.name: cge0361
posts.com:
>>52884757

• Always let the characters be themselves. If everyone gets along, if everyone agrees, if everyone knows what everyone else likes, if everyone uses the same kinds of phrases, then every one of everyone is one—one character talking to itself in alternating paragraphs. And if that character is the author, then there are zero characters. It's a monologue in a hall of mirrors. A good scene is one where the characters are at odds and the author has no idea who's going to win the argument or how.

• Always respect the reader's time. This can be tricky because every reader has different tastes, but always remember that the instant you're boring, the reader could close the tab and go next. Establish, but don't screw around. Like the advice of Chekhov's Gun, give the reader what's needed to see the scene, but don't get wrapped up in your fantasy land such that it becomes a character who isn't actually acting in the upcoming scene. Setting develops through the action, so ensure the action is relevant to the setting and both communicate efficiently.

(cont)

posts.name: cge0361
posts.com:
>>52884770

And a word about discipline:

It's very easy to second-guess, to want to pander to what's popular, and to be nervous about reception. Especially in the case of fan-fiction because you know that 99% of the apparent attention (hits, favs, etc.) goes to the lemons. A story asks a lot more of the reader (to pay attention on the scale of hours rather than to unzip for a few minutes) so truly you cannot judge your success on the same metrics.

Yes, it's nice to see a large hit count, but my sense of esteem and reception is in feedback.

• The people who write me with lists of questions about details in my stories.
• The people who tell me that my stories have affected them in ways that other media never has.
• The people who will say things like, "Just read the mienshao story," with that THE standing out, being the DEFINITE article that it is, as though there were only one mienshao story that exists (or at least, that stands out so distinctively that all others stand at its shadow).
• The artists who have generated fan-art unbidden to share how they saw the the words that I wrote when I wrote what I saw.
• The fact that, years removed from the writing (and after a few years of inactivity), I can spontaneously click on a /vp/ thread simply because Mienshao doesn't often inspire an art spam thread, and find something of myself in it.

Writing yourself takes courage because it might be a hit or a flop, and it's difficult for some to not take how a work is received as a critique of one's own worth. But only by telling YOUR stories as they are and leaving it to the audience to take them as they may do you put into this universe something truly unique.

I'll never see the numbers of the lemon farmers and the fetish panderers with my personal writing (at least till the day I find my wallet empty and have to sing for my supper), but no number of drive by hits or dismissive up-votes outweighs one piece of earnest fan mail.

Earn them and cherish them.

posts.name: cge0361
posts.com:
>>52886202
>felt a little rushed and somewhat of an asspull
It was rushed, and it was to finish off the experience, but it wasn't a decision I made; the hypnosis can't be sustained indefinitely, and with a police officer roommate, he's probably going to notice, even with an atypical schedule.

>Is it to fit the small town, conservative southern(?) sort of setting?
In the games, each town has a motif of some sort. I wanted to extend that in my region such that it functions somewhat like a federation of city states. Laws are broadly categorized into two groups; common in terms and enforcement everywhere, and variable per district such that enforcement and punishment is to the taste of the residents. D/P points out that while nearly everywhere tolerates close personal relationships between pokemon and their masters, Carthamus takes it seriously because that's part of their cultural value. Most places strictly regulate pokemon participation in commerce, while Linalool advertises that they periodically welcome pokemon to come and participate in discretionary spending if their masters will fund them. Obviously this story wouldn't be what it is were it set elsewhere, but that's true for any story regarding a cultural taboo.

>starting and finishing with the same line
I absolutely was aiming for a symmetry motif. That's why the POV was (originally) Maggie|Manny|Maggie*|Manny|Maggie, with the asterisk being that brief moment where the narrative leaps out of POV in the center for a moment completely removed from the telling-both-sides-in-turn pattern to emphasize the turn around while also making it clear that I'm breaking a POV rule and am probably doing so very deliberately.

Chapter 4 writer's blocked me on the first scene for quite a while, and it was very frustrating. Then I realized that Anton would be the one who's frustrated, my imagination jumped to see what was on the other side of the window pane and the chapter wrote itself in one blast.

(cont)

posts.name: cge0361
posts.com:
>>52887734

> Your writing in general has this nostalgic, pre-internet, small town americana feeling that i haven’t encountered anywhere else.
Pokemon itself, in its inception, is about just that, the world of childhood in (per Satoshi Tajiri's nostalgia) the 70's. While Pokemon hasn't been afraid of technology ("Technology is incredible!") each generation's given us some sort of portable technology that is clearly very limited in scope. Partially this is surely for game purposes, but it's clear that it's highly advanced in some regards while deliberately limited in others. Pokedex started as a sort of simple camera that happened to also be a scanning bio-tricorder and encyclopedia somehow. Telephony and FM radio trickled in at Gen 2. By Gen 5 I think it got video calling, etc. But for all this, kids are still going out and playing with magic animals all summer long, not vegitating on their analog of World of Warcraft or shitposting on 4chan all day.

I've been careful not to try too hard to justify that design decision, but I have been aware of the need to address the divide between the games' spirit and today's (and tomorrow's) technology. This is mostly done culturally through the dominant influence of the Pokemon lifestyle; a belief that it's important for everyone, starting as youths, to go out and explore the world with pokemon at their sides, challenging and facing danger and risk, and learning to overcome it. This opens the door to the today-maligned kind of culture wherein kids played outside unsupervised, developed responsibilities early in life, and learned to shoot rifles in their teens. And then it doubles down on it because in the world of Pokemon, kids travel the nation unsupervised, are responsible for raising and caring for their Pokemon aquired in childhood, and engage as sport the kind of battle that in its rawest form can easily be combat to the death.

(cont)

posts.name: cge0361
posts.com:
>>52887740

And there is of course an elephant in the room regarding the Truman Show issue: I've made it clear that people like Magnus, the second ship's crew, and Walter are NOT from the world of Pokemon, as are some stray artifacts like Sam's old book that led him to look up some old maps and find a continuity issue that was immediately swept away; that some people, like Mr. Well and his most trustworthy employees are working both sides; and that there's a sci-fi contrivance to make this triad of Real World/Ocimene/Acutal-Pokemon-regions function well enough to keep the region strongly isolated without actually separating it so much that it would need to turn to isekai-level tropes to make use of any external developments.

> Are you drawing from fiction you’ve read
Not that I know of. I'm not much of a fiction reader. I grew up reading textbooks on math, science, physics, etc. If anything I sometimes find parallels between what I've written and something else and wonder if I should lean into them or resist. For example, I'd never read Robinson Crusoe till people kept bringing it up in relation to Waterlogged; eventually I did and frankly I think my story's got a better structure; Defoe sent R. C. miracle after miracle early to get him unenslaved and then stranded but with access to supplies with which to establish camp. I made Magnus rough his way through it. Some of the things regarding the aforementioned RL/Oci/Pokeverse relationship could easily be decorated with Lost references, but so far I've refrained because unlike that show, I've got an idea for where my bullshit goes and how it will matter later.

> or maybe where you grew up.
I did grow up in the "go out and play" era, but I haven't consciously associated any locations in LL or otherwise with places I've known.

(cont)

Of course, that's not all of Maggie's story, since we see her again briefly in Eternally Vernal, and she and Kit cross paths with the protagonists in my next story. (Who also appeared quite briefly in E/V as their paths made near contact with Anthony, Carlos, and Warden.)

If I get off of my lazy and and onto my writing ass and get it done and out.

And of course, D/P is not the only one. I've gotten "hate you for the ending" remarks on Eternally Vernal, too. Which I agree with insofar as it's a very awkward ending owing to it being a prequel, which is a challenge since it runs contrary to my normal writing method, but it was a good experience and it does hold true to the essence of what I had in mind when writing LL but had no narrative justification to go into describing.

>A barrage of noise drew out the yelp that had been sitting at the bottom of her throat. Diane immediately threw a hand over her mouth and shot up from the edge of her seat. A paw grabbed her arm almost immediately. The Mienshao held her there, eyes somehow bright in the dim glimmer of the streetlight, and urged her to wait until the flock of Murkrow had passed.

>The wave of shame that passed over her smothered her heart. Diane sat down, still tense enough to break out into a run at any second, and let out a single choking sob. They pulled her close and held the back of her head in such a gentle way that she almost didn't feel it. Shuddering, Diane buried herself in their neck to muffle her cries, feeling a pair of strong arms wrap around her shoulders and a snout press through her hair.

While you're technically correct about quests, I wouldn't hand out raw experience. Firstly, quests might require a different team composition than the area boss, whether it be from typing differences or potential HM reqirements (if they ever bring those back). Secondly, if the player is concerned about being overleveled (as many people on /vp/ are), they might skip out on it because of that. The solution to both of these problems is to hand out EXP Candy instead, which also gives the added benefit of letting the player distribute it how they want if they need to level a specific Pokemon for a move or evolution. They can even save it for later if the game is already too easy for them, which would help them build up competitive teams in the postgame.

Why is Ghost weak to Dark? I can understand Psychic being weak to Dark since psychic represents the mind and the dark is a common fear. Also considering that Psychic was OP in Gen 1 and part of Dark's existence was to nerf Psychic type.

But what is the reasoning behind Ghost being weak to Dark? It doesn't make sense. Ghosts tend to love the dark, and a lot of ghost spirits are evil. Also, ghost was an awful offensive type in Gen 1 is already weak to itself. If anything, Ghost should resist Dark or at least be neutral to it.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52907099
Psychic and Ghost are weak to Dark because they're vulnerable to malice, which is what Dark is actually about, not "the dark."
Ghost-types themselves are often described as malicious and several Ghost-type moves fall within this scope (Spite, Grudge), but that doesn't imply that they would naturally resist it. They're susceptible to corruption and becoming vengeful, there are many stories in both Japanese and Western culture of an innocent spirit becoming evil and hostile after being offended, disturbed or desecrated in some way.
Psychic is vulnerable to Dark for similar reasons, ESP makes them more sensitive to the hostility and malice involved in Dark-type moves. This is also why Psychic is weak to Ghost, communing with spirits and being in touch with the supernatural naturally makes them more vulnerable to possession (as you see with the Mediums in the Kanto games).

posts.com:

Dark means Evil in Japan not dark.

posts.com: In Japan it's believed that spirits inhabit inanimate objects that people use, so think shit like toy story. Ghosts in Japan are not inherently evil or dealing with death. Dark adds that connection.

>>52906309
Having all the Champions there with their original VAs really goes far for not only the fanservice but the overall stakes of the tournament. This isn’t some schoolyard function in the hicks, everyone is taking it seriously and there’s no gags to bring the tension down. This is undoubtedly the most passionate group of trainers the writers have put into a tournament arc. There isn’t a single battle in the Alola or Kalos League that matches the amount of frustration and desperation Ash felt when facing Cynthia, for example.

Also having people watching from all over the world is a major positive for the scale of the tournament. Having all the Champions watch and commentate the battles, throwing in their own two cents mixed in with their own personality traits is just entertaining.

Despite the production problems you can really feel how much love was put into making this arc.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52897630
There's some interesting similarities between Kyurems area, Giants Chasm and Area Zero

Anyways, imo Kyurem is a separate member of the same species of pokémon that the original Dragon that begat Zekrom and Reshiram belonged to, perhaps older and depowered in some way, or maybe since it either came from space/was struck by the meteor that formed Giants Chasm it was corrupted or damaged somehow. That's why it's part Ice and wants to merge with one of the dragons, it's lost its ability to generate power. Additionally, I've always interpreted the splitting of the dragons to be fully transformational, with each dragon taking on an appearance fitting their role rather than being some sort of hybrid of Zekrom and Reshiram. Obviously it would have certain design similarities like being a bipedal likely winged dragon with big feet and a turbine tail, but would otherwise be fairly dissimilar from the two dragons, none of the weird mishmash of features you usually see.
Basically, I think the complete dragon would look like a healthy, fully powered Kyurem without the cold theme, possibly either fire/electric or having some sort of type switching ability linked to a held item or whatever.
I don't think it's the husk of the original Dragon because we only have one source for the claim, drayden, whereas everyone else believes it came from space. There's definitely a meteor impact that occurred there, the professor discusses it and Kyurem was almost certainly affected by it in some capacity, but I'm not convinced that it was a husk of the original Dragon. I am convinced that Black/White Kyurem is not an accurate depiction of the original Dragon though, that things just a freak.
